meanings.definition: Capable of being broken or fractured.
meanings.sent1: The old toy was very cascable and shattered easily.
meanings.sent2: The glass was so cascable that it cracked with a light tap.
meanings.sent3: The cookie was so cascable that it crumbled into pieces as soon as I touched it.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt cascable as he listened to the sad news.
meanings.sent5: The delicate vase was cascable, and the slightest bump would cause it to break.

meanings.definition: A part of a gunlock that holds the hammer in place.
meanings.sent1: The gunsmith carefully examined the cascable to ensure it was functioning properly.
meanings.sent2: He cleaned the cascable of the gun to maintain its performance.
meanings.sent3: The cascable of the gun looked like a tiny, intricate puzzle piece.
meanings.sent4: The cascable clicked into place, securing the hammer tightly.
meanings.sent5: The cascable was crucial for the gun to operate smoothly.
